title: Rolls of Lace 2 Rolls of Lace
content:

  Image: 

  object_work_type: lace (needlework)

  title_text: Rolls of Lace 2 Rolls of Lace

  preference: main alternate

  shape: irregular

  materials_name: cotton (textile)

  techniques_name: sewing (needleworking technique)

  object_colour: cream (color)

  physical_appearance: These are two rolls of lace. The roll on the left is bound by two gold strings. It has a shop label on top with some written inscriptions. The roll on the right is bound by a strip of paper
 also with some inscriptions. The rolls of lace look old and stained.

  subject_terms_1: implements (object genre) Peranakan

  subject_terms_2: Textiles Peranakan (Asian people) Lace and lace making

  subject_terms_3: Textile art and design

  sgcool_label_text: There are 2 rolls of lace of different design. The making of bobbin lace was an established tradition in port cities like Malacca and Palembang by the early 20th century. It is part of a donation which contains a mixture of materials used in the making of kebayas and baju panjangs.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: There are 2 rolls of lace of different design. The making of bobbin lace was an established tradition in port cities like Malacca and Palembang by the early 20th century. It is part of a donation which contains a mixture of materials used in the making of kebayas and baju panjangs.
